item.title: Rocket chip building
item.description: Installation and simulation of the Rocket processor Rocket is a fully-featured RISC-V processor capable of running Linux. Here, we will install the core and its toolchain. Setup Since we will need two different repositories, let’s setup a root directory rocket-root and clone both of the projects: $ mkdir rocket-root && cd rocket-root $ git clone git@github.com:chipsalliance/rocket-chip.git $ git clone git@github.com:chipsalliance/rocket-tools.git $ export ROCKET_ROOT="$HOME/path/to/rocket-root" The known checkout hash for the rocket-tools repository is noted in the file riscv-tools.

item.title: Adding instructions to the RISC-V Rocket core
item.description: Introduction The RISC-V ISA was born with modularity, extensibility, and open-source in mind. To this end, several processors have their source code available and can be modified to add co-processing units or even new instructions. Our objective here will be to add duplicated instructions in the Rocket core to implement the backbone of a security model presented in RIMI.
